description:
A reason why this idea is gaining attention is because currently there are no better ideas, there is a ready supply of survivors blood within close proximity to people fighting ebola, and it has been used in the past, in small sample size, to treat Ebola. Major flaws in this idea are that it requires extensive testing on nonhuman primates, something that takes a lot of time, and blood transfussions means a chance AIDS of Hepititus C is transfered. Because of the risk of spreading AIDS, this idea may never get off the ground.

Source: http://news.sciencemag.org/africa/2014/08/who-ponders-treating-ebola-infected-people-blood-survivors
summary: WHO is considering using  Convalescent serum to treat Ebola. This means transfusing blood of Ebola survivors into people fighting Ebola in hopes that the antibodies developed by the survivor to fight the virus can be used by the person fighting Ebola. While this is untested there is strong reason to believe it could be very helpful.
title: The use of Convalescent serum to treat Ebola is being considered by WHO
